title: Data Harmonization
text: Data people sharing data, privacy spectrum tradeoffs risks benefits individuals populations. Data collected individual-level one organization often shared another organization due legal restrictions organization-specific data governance policies. often interested community-level (e.g. neighborhood, census tract, ZIP code) data disaggregated gender, race, sensitive attributes. Achieving data harmonization upstream storage allows contribution disaggregated, community-level data without disclosing individual-level data sharing across organizations.

title: Data Harmonization
text: Like namesake, CoDEC encodes data streams communities live common format using census tract month can decoded different community-level geographies different time frames. CoDEC relies cincy R package define Cincinnati-area geographies interpolate area-level data census tracts, neighborhoods, ZIP codes different years.  Specifications defined checked using as_codec_dpkg() function R.

title: Data Harmonization
text: White House’s Equitable Data Working Group defined equitable data “allow rigorous assessment extent government programs policies yield consistently fair, just, impartial treatment individuals.” advise equitable data “illuminate opportunities targeted actions result demonstrably improved outcomes underserved communities.” group recommended make disaggregated data norm “… intentional data collected shared, well data protected exacerbate vulnerability members underserved communities, many face heightened risk harm privacy protected.” U.S. Chief Data Scientist, Denice Ross, declared “open data necessary sufficient drive type action need create equitable society.” Open data can fall short driving action equitable. Disaggregating data sensitive attributes, like race ethnicity, can elucidate inequities otherwise remain hidden.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cole Brokamp. Author, maintainer. Erika Manning. Author. Andrew Vancil. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brokamp C, Manning E, Vancil (2025). codec: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati. R package version 2.4.0.9001,  http://geomarker.io/codec/, https://github.com/geomarker-io/codec.

title: Community Data Explorer for Cincinnati
text: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati (CoDEC) data repository composed equitable, community-level data Cincinnati. Data communities live come different spatiotemporal resolutions extents often designed specific goal integrating data. CoDEC defines specifications community-level data effort make FAIR. Operating common data specification means organizations can easily use methods tools harmonizing, storing, accessing, sharing community-level data. data can described, curated, checked CoDEC specifications using codec R package. Using tools, collection extant community-level data resources automatically transformed harmonized, community-level data package openly available accompanied (1) richly-documented data catalog, (2) web-based interface exploring learning data, (3) API accessing data scale demand.  Data packages created transparently reproducibly using code assemble data automatically validate data structures. single point data consumption provides ownership process harmonizing data integrates well data governance, importantly, can provide data consumed multiple ways (e.g., dashboard, tabular data file, API). Creating maintaining open community-level data resource equips entire community data-powered decision making boosts organizational trustworthiness. Demonstrating reliability capability appropriately managing shared data helps earn trust organizations communities intended served.

what: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
title: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
text: CoDEC Specifications: data must include census tract identifier column (.e., census_tract_id_2010, census_tract_id_2020). column must contain 11-digit GEOID identifiers every census tract Hamilton County, OH. data includes year column (year), integer year representing vintage data (e.g. 2021). data can optionally include month column (month), integer month year. Data must structured tidy format row observation specific census tract specific year (month).

title: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
code: as_codec_dpkg(   x,   name,   version,   title = character(),   description = character(),   homepage = character() )  is_codec_dpkg(x)

title: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
text: x data.frame tibble meeting CoDEC data specifications name see dpkg::as_dpkg() version see dpkg::as_dpkg() title see dpkg::as_dpkg() description see dpkg::as_dpkg() homepage see dpkg::as_dpkg()

title: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
text: as_codec_dpkg, dpkg object is_codec_dpkg, logical

title: Convert a tibble to a CoDEC data package — as_codec_dpkg
Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo
text: CAGIS data (see install_cagis_data()) provides list addresses Hamilton County. Addresses filtered following criteria: use addresses STATUS ASSIGNED USING orphaned (ORPHANFLG == "N") omit addresses ADDRTYPEs milemarkers (MM), parks (PAR), infrastructure projects (PRJ), cell towers (CTW), vacant commercial lots (LOT), miscellaneous non-residential addresses (MIS, RR, TBA) s2 cell derived LONGITUDE LATITUDE fields CAGIS address database

title: Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo
text: simple features object columns cagis_address, cagis_address_place, cagis_address_type, cagis_s2, cagis_parcel_id, cagis_is_condo, geometry column (s2_geography)

title: Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo

About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: CoDEC data package specifications provide set patterns designed make sharing tabular community-level data easier. Examples type data include pediatric hospitalization rate per month per census tract, total number gunshots per season per neighborhood, housing code enforcement density per year per ZIP code. Data specified average values total counts census tract geographies specific year (year month). required census tract identifer year (year month) columns CoDEC TDR contain spatiotemporal information can used link data.

title: About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: Maintainer: Cole Brokamp cole.brokamp@gmail.com Authors: Erika Manning Andrew Vancil

POLYGON ((969890 1856864, 969912.…          30.0   2024 #> # ℹ 71 more rows

code: if (FALSE) { # use aws command line to login interactively via profile sso account" system2("aws", c("sso", "login", "--profile", "geomarker-io")) # make sure to set AWS_PROFILE so the AWS CLI tool knows to use it by default" Sys.setenv("AWS_PROFILE" = "geomarker-io") }

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: Census block-level weights used spatially interpolate CoDEC data packages census tract-level Cincy geographies.

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: CoDEC data package simple features object returned one cincy_*_geo() functions (.e., cincy_census_geo(), cincy_neighborhood_geo(), cincy_zcta_geo()`) weights census block-level weights use; see details

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: tibble new geographic identifier column target geography (geoid) addition (interpolated) columns

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: Block-level total population (pop), total number homes (homes), total land area (area) 2020 Census can chosen use weights. Geospatial intersection happens transforming geographies epsg:5072. See codec_as_sf() adding geography CoDEC data package. Variables beginning "n_" interpolated using weighted sum; variables interpolated using weighted mean.

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate

Install CAGIS GIS database — install_cagis_data
text: installs CAGIS Open Data GIS database (.gdb) data directory codec package. downloaded, reused across R sessions computer. geodatabase contains many layers updated quarterly. (Historical geodatabases available .)

title: Install CAGIS GIS database — install_cagis_data
text: cagis_data_url url CAGIS Open Data .gdb.zip file; changes quarterly, check something recent file found

title: Install CAGIS GIS database — install_cagis_data
